subject: Re: [junit] junit for set Method with boolean input and void return
msgSnippet: ... Kamal, Do you really want to test the state of a field?  I assume that there s some other behavior in WmLoggerFilter that is affected by the state of
messageBody:
Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> public void testsetAcceptMatch() {
>
> WmLoggerFilter subjectWmLoggerFilter = new
> WmLoggerFilter();
>
> subjectWmLoggerFilter.setAcceptMatch(true);
>
>
>
> }
>
>
>
> Now, which assert method should I use to see if "acceptMatch" is true or
> not.
Kamal,

Do you really want to test the state of a field? I assume that there's
some other behavior in WmLoggerFilter that is affected by the state of
setAcceptMatch--would you be better off testing that? This is a
different answer than you've heard so far, and I think both have their
merits.

David Saff
